Detailed Description

Linear shape function on the symmetric unit interval.

Linear shape function on the interval [-1, 1]. (i.e. 2 element nodes). You will rarely use this class directly, but might plug it into your own FE traits class as shape_function_t.

Member Function Documentation

size_t imaging::Linear1dShapeFunction::face_node ( size_t  face,
size_t  node 
) [static]

Returns the node index (on the element) of the node determined by face_index and face_node_index (on the boundary reference element). E.g. the vertex 1 (there are only vertices 0 and 1 on the boundary reference element) on the face 2 of the square reference element (there are 4 faces with indices from zero to 3) is mapped to vertex 3 on the reference element.

Reimplemented from imaging::ShapeFunction< 2, 1, 1 >.

References imaging::Interval1dTransform::face_vertex().

float_t imaging::Linear1dShapeFunction::value ( size_t  node,
const ublas::fixed_vector< float_t, 1 > &  in 
) const

Returns the value of the shape function corresponding to node at in.

Computes the gradient of the shape function corresponding to node at in and stores the result in out.
